speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: SCENE VI. Alexandria. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's camp.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Flourish. Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, AGRIPPA, with DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS, and others

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Go forth, Agrippa, and begin the fight:

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Our will is Antony be took alive;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Make it so known.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Caesar, I shall.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The time of universal peace is near:

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Prove this a prosperous day, the three-nook'd world

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Shall bear the olive freely.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Antony

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Is come into the field.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Go charge Agrippa

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Plant those that have revolted in the van,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: That Antony may seem to spend his fury

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Upon himself.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Exeunt all but DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Alexas did revolt; and went to Jewry on

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Affairs of Antony; there did persuade

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Great Herod to incline himself to Caesar,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: And leave his master Antony: for this pains

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Caesar hath hang'd him. Canidius and the rest

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: That fell away have entertainment, but

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: No honourable trust. I have done ill;

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Of which I do accuse myself so sorely,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: That I will joy no more.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Enter a Soldier of CAESAR's

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Enobarbus, Antony

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Hath after thee sent all thy treasure, with

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: His bounty overplus: the messenger

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Came on my guard; and at thy tent is now

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Unloading of his mules.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: I give it you.

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Mock not, Enobarbus.

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: I tell you true: best you safed the bringer

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Out of the host; I must attend mine office,

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Or would have done't myself. Your emperor

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Continues still a Jove.

speaker: Soldier
text_entry: Exit

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: I am alone the villain of the earth,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: And feel I am so most. O Antony,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Thou mine of bounty, how wouldst thou have paid

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: My better service, when my turpitude

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Thou dost so crown with gold! This blows my heart:

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: If swift thought break it not, a swifter mean

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Shall outstrike thought: but thought will do't, I feel.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: I fight against thee! No: I will go seek

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Some ditch wherein to die; the foul'st best fits

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: My latter part of life.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Exit
